form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Roberts (for himself and Mr. Moran) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To authorize States to enforce pipeline safety requirements related to wellbores at interstate storage facilities.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Underground Gas Storage Facility Safety Act of 2015.
Section 60101(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (20), (21), (22), (23), (24), and (25) as paragraphs (23), (24), (25), (20), (21), and (22), respectively;
in paragraph (21), as redesignated, by striking and at the end;
in paragraphs (22) and (24), as redesignated, by striking the period at the end of each paragraph and inserting a semicolon;
in paragraph (25), as redesignated, by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
underground natural gas storage wellbore means the piping and hole drilled connecting the surface of the earth with the underground natural gas storage reservoir.

section.header: State enforcement of pipeline safety requirements
section.text: Section 60104(c) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking A State authority that and inserting (1) A State authority that;
by striking A State authority may not and inserting the following:
by striking Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, a State authority may enforce a requirement and inserting the following:
Notwithstanding the limitation set forth in paragraph (2), a State authority may—
by striking chapter 61. and inserting chapter 61; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: enforce a State requirement for the safe construction and operation of underground natural gas storage wellbores if—

clause.text: the State authority has consulted with the Secretary respecting the State requirement; and
the Secretary does not object to the State requirement during the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the consultation described in clause (i) is initiated.
